Authors:
Donatha D. Tibuhwa, Sanja Savic, Leif Tibell, Amelia K.
Kivaisi
Title:
Afrocantharellus gen. nov. is part of a rich diversity of
African Cantharellaceae
Keywords:
Africa; Afrocantharellus; ATP6; Cantharellus;
Cantharellaceae; ITS; LSU; Molecular phylogeny; New genus.
Abstract:
A new genus in the Cantharellaceae, Afrocantharellus, is
proposed based on results from phylogenetic analyses of rDNA LSU and
concatenated LSU/5.8-ITS2/ATP6 data. Comprehensive fieldwork and the
acquisition of numerous sequences for previously neglected African
Cantharellus species formed the basis for a reappraisal of generic and
species delimitation. The genus is characterized morphologically by the
basidiomata having thick, distantly spaced diverging gills of variegated
colour. In contrast to most of Cantharellus, Afrocantharellus mostly
lacks clamp connections. Phylogenies of Cantharellus and
Afrocantharellus based on LSU and a concatenated data set are provided,
along with descriptions of and a key to the species of Afrocantharellus.
New combinations in Afrocantharellus are proposed.
